meanings.definition: A person who settles in a new colony or moves into new territory.
meanings.sent1: The colonizer built a new home in the unexplored land.
meanings.sent2: The colonizer arrived in the foreign land with hopes of starting a new life.
meanings.sent3: The colonizer found a cozy spot to set up camp in the uncharted territory.
meanings.sent4: Like a pioneer, the colonizer ventured into the unknown, seeking a place to call home.
meanings.sent5: The colonizer's presence transformed the untouched wilderness into a bustling community.

meanings.definition: To establish a colony in; settle.
meanings.sent1: They decided to colonize the uninhabited island and make it their own.
meanings.sent2: The explorers planned to colonize the new land and create a thriving community.
meanings.sent3: The group of settlers aimed to colonize the fertile valley and cultivate the land.
meanings.sent4: Their mission was to colonize the distant planet and adapt to its unique environment.
meanings.sent5: With determination, they set out to colonize the vast expanse of uncharted territory.
